main event: Multiple eyewitnesses reported seeing a strange object or lights in the sky over Columbus, Ohio on 31st July 1949.
interesting points: The description of the object as being oval-shaped, greyish-blue in color, and about five times the size of the United States Navy airship, 'Constitution'.
Witnesses reported seeing circular flares dropping from the object, resembling the heat from a blast furnace, followed by a brilliant white sphere about one-fifth the size of the setting sun.
One witness stated that the lights were traveling slowly in a southerly direction, while another saw the same lights in a westerly direction.
Eyewitnesses provided detailed descriptions of the object, including its altitude, direction, and apparent size, contributing to a comprehensive picture of the sighting.
One witness was noted to have a background in science and astronomy, having read many scientific fictional and non-fictional books, adding credibility to their observation.
